review: I usually am okay with Red Robbin, but this location is not good. I have had two friends get food poisoning from this location. Stay away!

Bartender Brian was awesome, attentive, kept me informed of when my takeout would be ready. Ordered the veggie quesadillas. There were delicioius. Right temperature. Came with sour cream, salsa, and guac. Would definitely return if in the area again.

Not too satisfied with this locaction. When they first opened, it was always an enjoyable experience. Now, not so much. The service is the sore thumb. I have a hard time pinning this on the staff so I hold management responsible for this. Things seem to be inefficient at all hours of the day.  Everyone is polite. They just seem to not check in with you or get you what you need (like extra fries are hit and miss) . It seems the individual servers are always overwhelmed or get stuck working on tedious and time consuming tasks while my food is standing on the counter getting cold. This is especially true of tables served directly by the bartender who is responsible for making all the drinks in the place (obviously) . This leaves less time for his/her tables. The only reason this isn't 1 star is BC when I do get my food before it's cold and I get everything I asked for (I just wanted an extra basket of fries), it's good stuff. However, getting "all " of that has proven to be a challenge so I'm thinking I need to drop this place, or just this location.

Maybe 2.5 stars.   Been here quite a few times.  I like supporting our local Lincoln businesses.  However, the RR is hit and miss.  First few times we came here it was always good.  Prompt service, hot food.  Last few times have been hit and miss.  Like someone else said, the servers are nice enough but something is wrong.   Went their again on 5/17, Open House night for Lincoln schools.  Thankfully we got there right before the mad rush.  Come to find out from our server (who was very nice and over-worked), they sent people home at 6:00 because they weren't busy.  By 7:00 the line was out the door and food took 40+ minutes to come out.  Even getting a refill on fries took 20 minutes. We have had other instances of frozen burgers being served, wrong orders delivered, etc.  It's becoming harder and harder to come back given the other choices in the area. BUT the beer is cold and it's close so I'm sure I'll give it another try.  Just keep you expectations in check.

Red Robin will work in a pinch, but it is not my first choice for a good burger in the area.  The patties themselves are typically under seasoned, though well cooked.  There is just a feeling of blandness to the whole plate in my experiences here.  However, my kids love it so I'm stuck coming here every so often.  The endless fries are nice once you hit them with the seasoning on the table. My high point here are the servers.  They are always timely, attentive, and friendly.  At least there is a high point to discuss in this review.  Because it won't be the food, pricing, or decor.  If you're in a hurry or just aren't very picky about your burgers then Red Robin is a safe bet.  Otherwise, look elsewhere.

This is one of those weird 90's chain restaurants I guess??? Anyways this restaurant annoys the crap out of me... it's kind of disgusting...  every time I have ever eaten at one of these restaurants I feel like I am being waited on for fast food that tastes like it came out of a box.... Waiters are friendly in a way that REALLY CREEPS ME OUT EVERY TIME... the last time I went to one of these places the waiter hit on my friend and I hated every minute of my experience there.

My bf and I come here when we are taking his son out to dinner with us. The location across from Galleria is closer to us but this one is always a little less crowded. Though we get great service at either location, we prefer this one. We've never been disappointed in our food. The staff is great with kids. They are always very friendly and on top of your needs

This is prolly my favorite place to go out to eat with the kids. AND, they have recently updated their menu to be soooo much more vegetarian friendly! They have a great veggie burger that you can request to be served a multitude of ways! I also like that the minute you sit down, you can pre-order french fries to keep the kids happy! Ok, it keeps the adults happy too! The service is always really good. I just tried their new raspberry lime drink and it was yummy and bottomless, so...If I am being completely honest, it's not going to be one of the first ten places I am going to consider to grab dinner with a friend, but if we have the kids and we don't feel like cooking, this is by far, my #1 choice!

Sorry guys, your were the best place in Lincoln to get a burger..... My son and mother came to get a burger they were told that they could sit anywhere in the bar, the bartender came over and brought their first drink but they did not know what they wanted yet, 25 minutes later and my diabetic mother now shaking were asked what they wanted. we wrote it off to everyone has a bad day and again tonight 9/29/12 we Hubby, 2 friends and myself went in.... We had to ask for almost everything twice and my Brother ordered the pig burger and got a burger with no pig!! when we told the server I thought they would bring him a whole new burger, wrong! we were all done with our meals and they brought him bacon in a cup to put on his cold burger himself, really???? When we all looked at server and said really she said Ill let my manager know, he got a fresh burger but Really we were already done.  We went out together to eat together and he was eating alone.  Sorry for me and you Red Robin but we will be going to the Roseville store for now anyway, if we go back at all.

We came here on a Friday night because hubby had to get his free Birthday burger for being a part of the loyalty club! If you are a part of their loyalty club, every 8th burger is free! Darn good deal! We were seated immediately, even though it was prime dinner hour.  I guarantee that if you go anywhere in Roseville or Rocklin at 6pm on a Friday night,  you would be looking to wait at least a half an hour for your table. We love this Red Robin, it's right down the street from our house and they have never disappointed us. On this particular evening our waiter was Enrique, he was awesome! Very attentive and expedient. I liked the fact that there wasn't a thing that we had to ask him to get for us, like napkins, refills, etc. I don't know why the low rating?  Every time we've come here we've been pleased with both food and service. The price was decent too, for the three of us, it was a little over $30, not including the tip. That's three burgers( one being free), two alcoholic drinks, and a soda!

The one good thing about this place is that they're consistent. Their service is consistently horrific. I've been to this place more than a handful of times over the past couple of years because this one seems to be less busy than the Red Robin in Roseville. My drinks are never refilled, it takes over ten minutes just to get a basket of fries and ranch after ordering, my burgers occasionally come out cold, and they have even brought out my order wrong more than once. I should also mention that whenever I'm there, they're never all that busy. After about my tenth visit, I refuse to return to this Red Robin for their lack of service. If you're really craving a great burger from Red Robin, please drive a few more miles to the one in Roseville. This Red Robin doesn't deserve your hard-earned money.

The food here is okay.  However, there are a few problems.  1. The service was way too slow.  It took at least 15 minutes to get our drinks. Our server said the bar was backed up, but it was a slow Tuesday night. It also took probably another 15 minutes to get more fries, twice.  I could have picked up fries at McDonalds and drove back in less time.   2. The service was poor.  The hostess was chatting with another worker. As we walked in she asked "How many?" then noticed that she had been ignoring this woman who had been standing there and came in before us.  Awkward moment.  When the waiter told us the bar was backed up, he disappeared, and didn't offer or just bring water over.  We got the water with the drinks.  When my friend asked for more fries again, the waiter came back about 10 minutes later and asked if anyone had gotten the fries for him.  They hadn't.      3. They have a $5 margarita that is about 8oz.  Maybe 10oz at most?  I've never seen a margarita that small.  Most places serve at least a 12oz to 16oz margarita for $5-$7, and this was supposed to be part of their 'happy hour' specials.  It was in a small cocktail glass.  The margarita was blended, and someone dropped it off without a straw, which the waiter saw and corrected.  I asked him if they had made a mistake on the size of the margarita.  He said that's the normal size.   I can't say I'd suggest this place until the service improves.  They also need to either make bigger margaritas or charge less for them.  The food was fine, good fries, decent burger.

Excellent service. The waiters are always friendly and take care of you. Drinks are very good, burgers are good. I wouldn't order anything other than a burger tho for your main. I ordered the french dip, and it was microwaved meat that was chewy, and had a gross taste. If you stick to the burgers, you're better off.  Overall a pretty good place to eat a good burger and hang out. If you're lookin' for somewhere "nice", this is probably not the place. It is more of a family place.
My wife and I had dinner at this Red Robin, the food was great, the service was great, we would highly recommend it. It has a great family feel to it.

We went to Red Robin yesterday (Friday) at about 5:30PM. The place was about half full. We were greeted by someone at the desk who was about to seat another group, so he asked one of the other front desk staff to seat my group which consisted of me, my wife and our daughter.  He initially checked on one side of the restaurant and there was not a booth available, so we went to the other side. He was about to seat us at a table, but I saw that there were about 7 booths available on that side. When I asked if we could sit in one of the booth's he got an annoyed look on his face, but took us to one of the booth's. At no point after I asked to sit in one of the booth's did he say one more word to us.  He left us there and after about 15 minutes, and watching people who came in after us, a female server came to get our drinks and let us know that she was helping our server who had not yet come to our table. She was friendly and took our drink and appetizer order, which came and were finished before our server made it to our table to take our meal orders. He said very little when he did make it to our table and did not offer any apologies for not taking care of us in a timely manner. The food, when it finally arrived, was good. Our water was refilled once and then we were left with empty water glasses.  One other note. They had a huge sign inside the restaurant about honoring veterans. I am a veteran and had my Navy ball cap on and had asked if Red Robin had a military discount. They do not have a military discount and, based on my experience last night, they do not honor vets. The discount is not a big deal. Acting professional is. Especially in a service industry.
They have taken almost all of my old favorites off of the menu and the service here both times was not good. First time, server was overbearing and second time non-existent.

Though my last experience wasn't terrific, I decided to go back to this location for my cakeday free hamburger and I'm glad I did. Brian the bartender provided excellent service. I never went thirsty, and he was QUICK with refills on the steak fries! The food was really good this time too.
Came here on August 30th for lunch. We had the best service by Dee and everyone else who helped us. The food was excellent! Glad we made the decision to return.

I always have steered away from this place, because it looked like another Applebee's-style generic piece of crap. But the food actually wasn't bad, I liked the all-you-can-eat fries concept and service was fantastic. Very kid-friendly too.
Great lunch menu... great place for a late lunch... extremely friendly servcie... especially from Silvia... thanks for always making me feeel welcome.

Took our grand daughter to have dinner, at her choice of restaurants. She chose the local Red Robin. When we arrived the establishment was less than half filled but the greeter insisted that we sit in a rather congested area; probably to please the server. We waited 10 minutes for a waiter, then another 25 minutes for our food to arrive. The food was rather bland and quite over-priced for the quality. Service was sub-standard.

Went to this restaurant last week to get a burger... the patty has gotten smaller...l have enjoyed better fries at other establishments. Who cares if the fries are bottomless if they are subpar...there are fast food joints with better fries......

So it's been awhile since I've been to a Red Robin and was greeted by a new menu with some interesting additions.  I went with the Clucks and Riblets.  Everything was good except the Riblets where a let down. Good flavor, but meat over cooked.  All around great place especially if you have kids.

1 year ago this pace was a easy 3.5 stars. now its barely deserves 1 star. last visit was  2-15-14 was myself wife, 3yr old son and a friend. After being seated in a giant high booth when asking for a table the hostess realized that the high chair isn't tall enough for the tables so moved us. Than waited another 15 minutes for someone even came and took a drink order. 10 more minutes and out drinks show up, dropped off by someone other than our server. 10 more minutes pass and we finally get to order. out friend orders  a vanilla milk shake with his order.20 minutes later shake shows up. 25 minutes after that out food shows up, yet we have no silver wear which we ask our server for. granted our food order was easy 2 salads some soup and mac and cheese one burger. 10 more minutes of food getting cold we have to stop another employee who has silver wear in  his hand if e can have that. so already not going well on this trip. Well when time to pony up for the bill friend and I decide to split the check, we got the two checks and put our cads in. 10 minutes later he comes back drop off the two recipes for us to sign. Well looking I see that it isn't my check and belongs to someone else. I let a server know. !0 minutes later  my check shows up minus my credit card. I sign the check and such and let them know that my credit card isn't there. the server gets an OH  fck look on his face.10 more minutes of us seeing htem franticly search. than a manager comes and sits down with us letting us know our server  might have put my credit card into someone else's check and that he believes they walked out with it. my face OH Fck. yah had to cancel my credit card and needless to say this the last time I ever at at red robin. Oh yeah on top of that all our food was cold and really bad. STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION

A couple of days ago I went for dinner with the family and received great service here. I had a blue burger and love that they will cook it rare or medium rare. The burger was cooked to perfection and really juicy. Always a great experience at this Red Robin.
I love this place. I tend to sit at the bar when I come in, but I always get good service, and leave like I got my money's worth. Draft beers are boring, but best burgers around in my opinion.
Yuck!  Metallic tasting french fries combined with a pushy server equals a waist of money.  Menu repeats items over and over...... I will never go to ANY Red Robin again.

Went to Red Robin with a friend the other night. Had Nathan as a server, and WOW! He's a terrific server! I was very pleased. He was very fast, and polite. Even when our food was taking a while, he offered us fries as we waited and kept our drinks full. Tremendous! I'll be back JUST for him. Keep up the good work! Great food as well!

Sadly. ...I have to update my previous review and can no longer give the 5 stars I originally did.  Since the recent remodel we have been in there a couple times.  The last time was probably just that. . Wait staff was sloppy in appearance. ..too obnoxiously friendly. .. Not in a good way. .. But the worst is how filthy the place is.  How could they go to the expense of the remodel and pay no attention to the DISGUSTINGLY dirty window blinds.  The food was ok... But not worthy of the over inflated price.  You lost a couple of loyal customers.

Macy and Enrique were very pleasant and made my experience at this Red Robin a good one.  They were very quick and efficient.  They brought out everything in a timely manner and did not seem to be put out when asked to refill ranch dressing, water, bring extra napkins, bring out more fries without the seasoning.  Very patient and cheerful!  I would recommend the Red Robin to anyone in the area.
Great food and great servers. I love coming here and having dinner. And I love their new decor and things that they have out. Also love that they play football when it's on.

We have been here a couple times. However, the second time was worse than the first.. it took so long to get our food. I get this is a chain. They should have a better system in place. We ordered two burgers and fries.. one burger came out, was eaten 3/4 of the way, then the other burger showed up. It is like the little waitress forgot the second burger. Probably not a good. If you brings kids, be prepared to keep them busy for a while.

I've been to Red Robin many times. Yesterday was the first time in months since I've gone and I was very disappointed. Not only did our food take almost an hour to get to us(it was only 2 burgers) when we got our food, the fries were disgusting! The fries were cold and very hard...like they weren't cooked thoroughly. I didn't eat them at all. Our burgers  weren't hot at all to the point where the cheese wasn't even melted. And when I asked for my burger to be cooked well done aka no pink at all...what do I get...pink in my burger! I didn't complain or say anything because I work in a restaurant myself, and I hate complainers and I wasn't going to wait another hour for my food to be redone. plus my friend was already running late for work. The only good thing out of all of this was my drink. I was very, very disappointed. I don't think I'll be going back any time soon.

Disappointed. Have visited this location multiple times. And worst experience was a little wait. Tonight was disappointing. Seated promptly. After 10 minutes and numerous servers walking AROUND us, and no acknowledgement, went tonlet hostess know we hadn't even been offered water. She said she'd take care of it...meantime, another family is seated behind us. After 3 minutes, still no acknowledgement to us, a server goes to the recently seated family and takes their drink order. We left.

Wow inexcusable! Hostess was great but we sat waiting w/ my son for 20 minutes w/o any waitress/waiter offering to give us a drink or just seeing if we needed anything.... This is  probably the worst red robin in terms of service. As a local resident I try to support local restaurants but w/ this type of service this place will close. They renovated but it seems like training is lacking and/ or a complete staff overhaul is needed. We walked out but definitely told their manager about the horrible experience!!!

Disappointing. Red Robin was so much better before they changed the look of the store and the presentation of the food. We came in for burgers and fries today and it was bad. My cheeseburger was raw and covered with charred bits of gunk from the grill and the fries were cold and greasy. The buns on all of our burgers were cold and squishy. When we asked for new fries, they threw the old fries back in the fryer and tried to pass them off as fresh. All I can say is don't try to pass off substandard food to someone with 10 years of food service experience.

Used to be okay, now less so.  Recently the restaurant changed the interior to update the decor.  With the new inside came an old horror...segregation.  Parties with children are now relegated to a section behind a partition.  Last time we arrived (3 kids in tow) and asked to not be seated in "Chuck E Cheese" (our pseudonym for the kids jail) the hostess lied to us and told us the other area was reserved for a party.  None arrived. Tonight, my wife arrived and asked how long the wait would be.  Sgt. Shultz informed her it would depend on whether she had children.  Colonel Klink tried to say as she left, "Vait! Ve can vix this!" Too late, as she had escaped. Seriously, really bad.  Don't go.

Recently I reluctantly visited Red Robin in Lincoln with my daughter and son. I am aware of their slow inattentive service, but decided I would give them another try in hopes that they have changed or I was wrong. Unfortunately they had proved me right. Mistake number 1. I arrived with a baby who needed a high chair. They place me in a table that was too high for a high chair. Mistake number 2. It took at least over 10 minutes to bring our drinks out. mistake 3. it took over 30 minutes to bring out our appetizer. I mean come on, unacceptable to wait 30 minutes for an appetizer, come on now we are hungry! mistake number 4. I took 20 minutes after they brought the appetizer out to  bring our food out. It was a mess. They never cleared off any dishes so we had a table with a very active baby that was trying to touch everything at the table and it was just about impossible to keep him from the dishes that can break or drinks that can be tipped over. Our dinner took about an hour in half in total. I know that normally a place like that, dinner should be around 45 minutes from start to finish. Overall, I would not go back to this place, nor recommend anyone else to go there unless they do not mind waiting, and waiting and waiting and waiting to get their appetizers and food!   About the food, ya its typical chain restaurant food, nothing special.

Went here for lunch today after golfing. There was a group of 4 of us. We usually go to the one in elk grove since that's where we live. We know what to expect and this was FAR from it. We sat there for about 15 minutes. We saw one waitress and one waiter in our area but they were going to other tables and ignoring us. The hostess came to the bar area and we asked when we were going to get drinks and she pointed to the male waiter and said he would be over in just a minute. After another 5 minutes the bartender came over and took our drink and food order and apologised to us. We obviously were not her responsibility since she was the only one trending the bar. Either this place is way sorry staffed or the wait staff just doesn't care. We will stick with the elk grove location and never go to this one again. The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because the bartender was caring enough to at least acknowledge us. Shame on the other staff!

I was recently here during the lunch hour and while the service was good, the food was far from it. I ordered the Whiskey River Chicken Sandwich. The bread was SO soggy that it fell apart after ONE bite. The chicken was like a brick and felt and tasted as if it had been microwaved to cook. Very disappointed in the food and would not come back.

I understand  that every establishment  has a bad day but I will probably  never go back to this location. I placed my order for pick up  and was told it would be 20 minutes. I showed up on time and they were slammed. There were 4 people in front of me, and the place was  full of unhappy  looking customers. It was another 15 minutes before I was told my food was not ready. I enden up waiting an hour before  I got my order. I took my food and drove 5 minutes to get home. The food was cold. I called the manager  who apologized and took my information  and said he would send out a gift card for my trouble. It has been a month and I have not received anything. I have even called back and was just put on hold for ever. In the future  I will drive the extra distance to the Roseville  location. The only good thing I have to say is the bar tender was exellent, she seemed to be the only person who knew what they were doing.
Had a great lunch. The Whiskey River BBQ ranch wrap was yummy.  Brian is an awesome server and kept us entertained with his sarcastic humor.

Service was sooooo slow. We had to wait nearly 10 minutes to be seated while the hostess cleared off tables. Took 45 minutes just to get one chicken sandwich and two kids meals. Food was awful when they brought it out. Fries not cooked all the way and a kids corn dog still soggy in the middle.  My chicken sandwich disintegrated in my hands as I tried to eat it because of the new cheap buns they are using that they probably picked up on clearance at the Rainbow bread outlet.

My neighbor took my daughter and his daughter here last night for his daughters bday dinner. I warned him about the slow service and he said : yeah I noticed it's pretty slow sometimes. When he brought my daughter home he was laughing because they where there for a hour and a half. Sounds like a great time with a 4 and 5 year old. Maybe people should bring in timers when they get seated so the staff can see that people sit there for 30 minutes before somebody takes there order.
Like the food and customer service. Even when we had a staff meeting and the fish fryer was down they came through for us and were awesome!!

My 5yo daughters favorite place no doubt. Become a royal Robin member and enjoy the savings. Love to go kick it with the family or friends have some can crafted cocktails and eat.        Try a adult milkshake to....

Their beautiful thick french fries (some call them steak fries) are gone. The fries I got were all sizes, some could have been used as potato chips. When I asked for better fries there was only a slight improvement. They used to have fries that I considered only second to McDonald's, now they are junk. The Black and Blue burger that you were supposed to eat with a knife and fork because of all the goodies was nothing like shown on the menu. There was very little except the meat and the bun and it was mostly bun.  I will never go to the Red Robin again!!

The service has improved and the food is good- it's a solid place to eat these days, especially if it isn't too busy.  It's kind of a saving grace for Lincoln, which recently lost its Mimi's( another solid place) and a few years before that it's Panera, Stix, Wendy's and almost every sushi place it's ever had.  Now it has one good ( but pricey) sushi place, one ok one , and one crap one. So we need Red Robin to offset the local small places that are hit-and -miss  ( Awful Annie's ) . Especially since there aren't enough good burger joints in Lincoln. Fatburger is in the casino, but you have to walk yourself and your kids through a smelly sleazy casino to get there- and it's just not worth it in the end. So Red Robin is your best bet in Lincoln, unless you want Mexican or the excellent Old Towne Pizza.

What an improvement! The restaurant was packed, our server was on top of it and the food was delicious! Such a huge improvement. They even had the employees from Roseville working there since their restaurant was closed from the fire. Great job Red Robin! Give them another chance Lincolnites and keep improving Red Robin!

Love the Tavern burgers. So good had it the last 2 times both very moist and cheesy. You can't beat all you can eat fries lol. It's definitely a place we like to have a "cheat" meal. I couldn't see myself ordering a salad here! The burgers are too good not to have. So come hungry and leave stuffed with French fries and juicy burgers.  Yuummmm! This location has okay service and usually not too crowded during the weekend like the citrus and rv locations.

Service is terrible! My bf and I have tried many times to give the Lincoln location another try, and they continue to mess up on our order every time/switch servers on us/don't check on us or give us the bill ryt away! I'm done with this place!

Very disappointed in the service provided at this Red Robin! I LOVE Red Robin and their food, but this location just all around SUCKS!  The service is SSSOOO SLOW! One could say that it was just an off day for the waiter/waitress. But I have been here multiple times and have had to wait unreasonable amounts of time for basic service. One time, it took our waitress 30 minuets AFTER we were done with our meal to bring us our bill. The service is beyond slow.  The food here is average. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's not. Don't get me wrong, Red Robin is one of my favorite places to eat because they have such great food! But this location does not meet up to this standard.    The bathrooms are always dirty. Every time I go, they are out of paper towels with garbage on the floor. I find it interesting how this location has so many employees, yet literally nothing ever gets done.  NOTE TO MANAGER(s): Train your employees better in customer service. It is unreasonable to wait over 30 minuets for a simple burger, and another 30 for the bill.  Overall, don't go here. Find another location! I'm sure your wait time will be a lot shorter, with better quality food.

Today was our youngest son's 4th birthday, so we took him to the Red Robin here in town to celebrate.  This has become a birthday tradition as you get a free meal on your birthday and it is a fun place to celebrate, especially for kids.  Our kids look forward to this birthday treat, and rightly so, our birthday boy was excited to go.  He talked about it all day.  Upon arriving he proudly announced to the server, as did my husband and I, that today was his birthday and that he was 4 years old.  He beamed with excitement. The server smiled and said that she would be sure to sing to him.  He was beyond thrilled to hear that.  After everyone was done eating dinner the server plopped down an ice cream sundae without saying a word and walked away.  My husband and I exchanged looks.  She returned a few minutes later and said "Happy Birthday, little guy" as she cleared some plates and walked away.  That was it.  Our son just sat there looking at his sundae.  I could tell that he was crushed.  We started singing to him, but just as we started a group of servers congregated at the table directly NEXT to ours as there were two birthdays being celebrated there.  The servers started singing 'Happy Birthday' to them.  Our son turned around in his chair and watched this take place.  When they were done singing the group of servers left and our son sat down in his chair and pushed his ice cream sundae away with tears in his eyes.  I was speechless.  Before I could even say anything to our son the servers returned to sing to that same table for a SECOND time because one of the persons celebrating their birthday had been in the bathroom when they sang the first time.  As they walked away -AGAIN- my son climbed into my lap and started to cry, saying, "why didn't they sing for me? I ate my whole dinner and I was a good listener."  I was crushed.  How do you explain to a 4 year old little boy that the server was possibly having an off night or whatever the reason was for her to be so thoughtless.  I worked in the restaurant industry as a server while in high school and college.  I get that it is a hard and an often times thankless job, but regardless I find tonight hard to excuse.  I talked to the manager on our way out and I honestly felt like he wanted to start laughing at my complaint.  I don't think you have to be a parent to know the importance of a birthday to a child.  My wife and I like to support local businesses here in town, but we will not go to Red Robin again.  This is not the first time we have had horrible service there.  We have been back several times since, hoping it would get better but tonight was a deciding factor for us. Update:  Since posting this review, I was offered a $10 gift card from Red Robin.  I declined to accept this gift card.  A gift card will not change the experience that I received and I will not be returning to this location.

horrible service, had to ask for utensils when the salad was served, waited over an hour for food that tasted bland, any condiments that we requested was never brought over....food was cold once it was served!! i was hoping this red robins would be like the one on Galleria... I was wrong. my daughter ordered chocolate milkshake and they brought out warm chocolate milk Yuck! they have major issues with the service and food quality!

This place has gone down hill. The serving sizes are significantly smaller and the bottomless fries are no longer bottomless if they cut the size in half it seems and then it takes 25 mins for each bucket and they will now only bring out one at a time. I have a family of 6, we can get about four fries each and it's empty and then we need to wait another half an hour for more, it's ridiculous! The wait takes forever, no one checks in on you. We used to love going here but won't anymore until there is new management that goes back to how they used to be! Plus I'll admit, the fry thing frustrates me, lol it got two stars cause it's clean at least.

Update: Red Robin made it right. They called my wife, sent her a nice note, apologized for messing up Mother's Day and compd her next meal. The manager took my wife's call and seemed really concerned about the lapse in service. Thought that was great. Original review: Generally, I love their burgers. As I'm sure the reviews have said, they rebranded Red Robin about a year ago and the burgers are much, much better. And more expensive! Unfortunately, service has not improved. Bottomless fries? That is a lie! I feel like every time I go there, in order to get fries, you have to fight someone. They give you about 6 with your burger (not exaggerating).  Today, I went here for Mother's Day along with my in-laws, wife and son. The waiter checked on us about 2 bites in and never came until it was time to pay. Well, I wanted more fries. We ordered 2 more orders.  After waiting 10 minutes, the waiter said they were coming right out. Another 10 minutes nothing. We left our bill money and just left. He was lucky we left any tip at all.

We came in for a Sunday lunch, and it was also my 10th Free item Rewards! The Best thing about RR is the Royalty Rewards and it is a nice treat to know you always get a Free Birthday burger on your Birthday month.  I think by now, I have used them the last 4 years and gotten at least 4 Free Birthday burgers, but this is the first time I can remember getting a Free 10th item! We got service by Victoria, she was very nice, helpful, and checked on us.  I highly recommend trying the Orange cream soda because as someone who rarely drinks soda, this was delicious and perfectly fizzy!!!!  It is everything I imagine a 1950's style soda shop would serve.  The flavor was awesome because I really love Orange creamsicles ice cream pops since I was a kid and that is exactly what the soda flavor reminded me of. I highly recommend trying the burgers, you definitely can't go wrong and there are sooo many choices to choose from!  Plus, enjoying bottomless french fries is pretty cool, which are cut like thick steak fries!  The most I've ever been able to eat is two servings, but the second refill always taste better because it is usually piping hot fresh.  We were asked a couple times if we wanted more fries, but two servings is always enough!   I like all their dipping sauces too, very tasty and even if I have to pay extra 50 cents or whatever, I really do not mind at all.  Every table has their Signature Blend seasoning, which is good and they also sell them, if you want to buy one to take home!  I like the new S & P grinders, those are actually very nice to have available compared to a regular Salt & Pepper shakers. I have tried a lot of their menu items over the years.  I definitely like RR waaay more than Chili's or Applebees, so this would always be my first preference.  The menu has good options and a variety of different choices, prices are very reasonable.   I love the French Onion soup,  I always order it!  They have great appetizers, I haven't tried much of the desserts though.  Their Strawberry Freckled Lemonade is AMAZING, I really like the Purple Popping drink too.  They have a pretty good Happy Hour if you want to order alcohol cocktail drinks or beers. The Southwest Chicken salad is one of my favorite things to order!!!  It's super good and Healthy.   I recently tried the Avo Cobb O salad and that was pretty good too, it's a big size and worth the $10.99 for all the toppings you get!  It comes with focaccia bread and that was yummy!  I feel like since the menu changed, and some RR restaurants got remodeled, it's just gotten so much better!  It's a nice family place too, you can bring your kids or grand parents or have large groups/small groups!  There is something for everyone to enjoy dining together. I am glad I had a good lunch experience here.  Thank you Victoria and Red Robin staff in Lincoln, CA.  The location was easy to find, tons of parking, and it's in a very nice area with other businesses, very close to Lowe's.   They also have cool bicycle parking here, you can ride your bike and have a decent place to lock it up at.

Once again Red Robin in Lincoln, CA. has let me down. My girlfriend just went there for lunch with a friend and ordered some onion rings for me to go before she left. She VERY CLEARLY ordered two small cups of fry sauce. When she got home there was no fry sauce. There was TWO cups of ranch dressing instead.
Simple, good service, good food but it is just a burger and fries joint so do not expect a steak dinner with all the trimmings. Fun and good for the family!

This location has generally been good to me and my family. The servers are almost always friendly and polite and the food always good. 99% of the time I get the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich and it has been consistently good. The fry servings have gotten smaller, but they still do the bottomless refills so it really isn't a problem except if you get an absentee server. This brings me to the negative part of this review: sometimes you get an inattentive server. One who rarely shows at your table and often forgets the things you request. And as good as the food is, it can take a looooong time to get it. It can also take a long time to get that final check. I still gave Red Robin in Lincoln four stars, because of the consistently good food and usually friendly staff.

The first time we came here, we were given cold fries and slow service. We decided to try it out again on the 4th of July because they were one of the only food services open. We walked up to the bar and I would say were seated for eight full minutes before we were even acknowledged. The bartender said "hi" and then proceeded to ignore us for about 10 more minutes. We didn't even have menus or water. Not only were they not busy, she was too worried about changing the  television channel for another customer. We got up and left immediately, I knew I would say something that I would regret.  XO Linda J.

I love Red Robin but the service in Lincoln is always horrible!  We tried it again last Sunday and our waitress was awful.  Everybody at the table had empty cups for some time and finally she brought refills.  Unfortunately she brought 3 cokes, nobody at our table was drinking coke.  The food took forever to come out and once served she never asked if we needed anything.  I'm done with this location.

My family and I have been to this Lincoln location many times.  Like many of the reviews listed we have been disappointed in the service with many horrible experiences both with management and service.  That is until tonight.  Tonight we had the best experience even though a mistake happened with a new waitress.  The fairly new manager (transferred from Roseville) Brett totally changed a horrible experience into a very positive experience.  The big difference is as a manager she truly cared about our experience as a customer.  She came to us with the mistake and made it more than right.  So for all you folks out there who love Red Robin but have written off the Lincoln location I would give them another chance.  I think with this manager who truly seems to care about the customer experience you will notice a change.

We come here often and love Red Robin but this particular location is poorly managed to say the least. We have given this location about 10 chances now and it never fails to disappoint. The service is so slow, the food is cold, takes forever to get a refill on fries, good luck if you need a drink refill! When you offer bottomless fries you should have them ready to go when asked, tonight we waited 15 minutes for them. The Manager seems like he has no idea what he is doing, it's always always a bad experience. The ONLY reason we go back is because we love the food (when it's not cold) but I could probably find a better burger place with better service.
We love Red Robin, we know what to expect we always get good service and the food is consistently the same!
My husband and I came here on a Friday for dinner. The place was really busy, however our food was served fast and hot. Everything was good.  Would recommend!

My party of 4 sat in the bar at 8pm at night. We waited about 10 mins before anyone acknowledged us. Our waitress only came by our table once to give us drink refills after we had to ask someone else for refills. There were two tables in the bar that were being used and it seemed like there were no servers. I love Red Robin and this is not normal. Didnt complain too much because i got my free birthday burger tonight.

What happened to this place?!?!?   There's been a steady  decline in food quality in only two short years and the food took such a long time to get to our table even though there were not many people dining at the time.  When we went the first time the kids Mac and Cheese was good and cheesy but now it was so dry and bland, my daughter was so disappointed.  My son ordered his burger medium rare and when it finally arrived it was well done.  He could taste burnt outer crust of what was supposed to be a patty.   I had the unlimited garlic fries with my burger but the fries were so bad I didn't want anymore.  I guess that's their way of keeping people from getting more.   When I think of garlic fries I'm thinking of some buttery garlic but all this was was just garlic powder sprinkled all over.  It left my mouth so dry I couldn't even eat half of them.  After we left the kids said Jack in the Box is better than this, and my daughter said we should have gone to Mooyah in Rocklin.   We really do like to support local businesses but don't plan on going back.
This location has terrible service. We waited over an hour just to get appetizers. And it isn't the first time we've had terrible service here. Next time we will go to another restaurant.

Staff was extremely friendly. How ever our food was burnt and cold like it had sat out to long. I had the waiter touch the chicken and he agreed it was completely cold and our burger was so burnt and hard you could break a window with it.  Sent it back and it still came back burnt..  Would give it one star but the staff was nice and tried to make it better but the food was just awful and cold. Management discounted it but we couldn't even eat it was to bad.

So, we haven't returned in a couple of years due to poor service. Thought we would give it another try. FAIL! What the heck, so overpriced now and the food is just okay. 2 of us ordered some 'premium burger' and I ordered the prime rib French dip. The French Dip was 'fair' and garlic (extra charge) fries cold. The 'premium-burger-recipients' also said their fries were cold. No one complained to each other but once one mentioned it we all agreed. The free fry refills are a gimmick (worked for me)...took FOREVER to get more fries and then mine were not the garlic I had paid extra for.  On the positive side, the waitress was spunky and nice and energetic (poor service kept us away in the past).

Why don't they get it?!?!?! In the past, I've left reviews, emailed corporate and left a comment on their new table device to no avail. I've even emailed the corporate office a copy of online complaints from a local Facebook group from many...many...many...unhappy locals.  It's truly disappointing Red Robin doesn't care about this location. The service is just mediocre.  My last visit was this past Sunday for a friend's birthday and the air conditioning wasn't working AND they didn't have hardboiled eggs.  But did offer to substitute them for cucumbers. Really? I wanted eggs for protein, not cucumbers.  I believe this location has a lackluster management and too relaxed of an employee-management atmosphere.  On another visit I witneased the manager on duty drinking a soda back in the area where employees get customer beverages,  food, etc.  This is a no-no!  On another visit,  the same manager is casually chatting with an employee as we walked in the door. Instead of promptly walking to the front and greeting us, he continued to chit-chat while we waited.  :( Lastly waiting for bottomless fries takes forever and when I ask for a well done burger, on more than one occasion, it comes out pink. Servers are always more than willing to take back the burger and are very apologetic, but they just need to step up their game and get things done right the first time. It would be different if these issues weren't an ongoing occurrence. We we want to keep our business local and not have to go out of town to have a nice meal.

Service is horrible, A server was bringing his food to our table and made the comment "Here ya go fatties" to my and my group of friends? Clearly he was trying to be funny but I found it completely inappropriate. I haven't been back since

We went here Nov. 1, 2015 in the evening.  The Waitress came and brought our drinks, a little bit later she showed up to take our order.  Food arrived and it was ok, tried numerous times to flag our waitress down for refills on tea and our first order of bottomless fries.  I flagged a waiter down who brought a refill on tea, he said our waitress would bring more fries it never happened.  Both the Men's and Women's restrooms were unkempt.  Upon resigning to the fact that we weren't getting fries we asked for our checks, two different checks, We were brought two of the same checks. Got that resolved and gave the waitress our credit card , the waitress swiped it in their kiosk and said it was accepted, the other person paid cash on their ticket.  The kiosk printed a receipt which showed a 20% tip had been taken, many other things went on after this situation which led me to ask for a manager, I waited and eventually just chased him down in my Wheelchair.  I told him what happened with the kiosk and he said he was sorry, I explained that the service we received was no where near worthy of a 20% tip,  he said he would talk with his staff, I further let him know that his shirt buttons were undone and he didn't even have a name tag on to which he said I'm sorry it's been a busy day.  I told him we would not be back ever and that I would let as many people as I could know of the type service they provide.  It was not busy either the whole time we were their!

The Red Robin burgers are usually amazing!  But, sadly this location the food tasted like it was cooked four hours earlier?  The fries were not fresh either... ?  .   A waste of my $13.50.  My Coke had so much ice in it, I had like five sips and it was gone!   I don't like being so negative, but when I'm paying this much money it would be nice to have FRESH food.

Wish I could give 0 star. I usually like to give nice reviews but this place is just plain waste of space in Lincoln. Might as well go to Roseville and spend your money there. Server only took our order, give us our food, and then told us hey if you're ready you can just slide your card in this machine and you're ready to go. Wow might as well go to Carl's jr if I want something like this to happen. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE.
The only downside to this place is everything seems to take a long time.  Plan to be here for about an hour.

This location is by far the worst I've been to. We live here in Lincoln and every time we go (not too often really) we get awful service. Last night we went in and were seated right away. Not one time in the 15 min we were there did anyone come up to us. We stopped 3 ppl (two servers and the manager) and all 3 said someone will be with you shortly. Well 15 min waiting no one came, other ppl were being helped, we have two kids who were thirsty and hungry. Therefore we walked out and no one stopped us. We will never go back! Awful customer service and shame on you manager for not stepping up and just helping us rather than saying someone will be with you.

Terrible service on pick up order.  Was told order would be ready in 15 to 20 minutes.  Got there about 25 minutes later after calling and they said our order was getting boxed.  We paid and 30 minutes later and several times as if our order was ready.  They brought our food out.  No manger over to say sorry for the wait.  Nothing.  Service has gone down hill at that food chain.
Another horrible experience.   We keep hoping they will improve, but they do not.  Sat for 10 minutes without being helped, left, went to Casa Ramos where we were seated and served within 10 seconds.

What has happened to Red Robin??? This used to be a fun place to go with the family, but now it's just annoying with those money sucking, distracting tablets on the table. Not to mention it takes up room. Service is subpar and quality of food is where Red Robin really fails! My kids used to love coming here for the burgers and I was happy they had good salads. The last time we came here, my son ordered a cheeseburger and the meat and cheese looked like it had been sitting under the heat lamp for 30 min or so. His fries were cold too. Oh, And I wonder if they don't do the "bottomless fries" anymore because we never got any before our meal and were never asked if we wanted more.  My BBQ chicken salad was awful! Lacked flavor and lettuce was disgusting. Chunks of iceberg lettuce that was all brown and the "mixed greens" were brown too. The quality of what was served was definitely not worth $11 for a salad at all!! I've had prepackaged salad from the store that was much fresher and tastier.  I'm really disappointed at this chain. It is not like it used to be. I would really like to see them get rid of those tablets, I think they're annoying and a waste of space. If people really want to play games, I'm sure they will use their phones/iPad/tablet in which they already pay for. Or maybe, they will have conversations with each other like the old days. Also, if the restaurant is dying down a bit after the dinner rush, please train your servers to be aware of their surroundings. No one wants to hear or be around immature behavior. I won't comment on what we witnessed, but try and act a little professional even if it's your time to go home.  My family and I will not be coming back to Red a Robin for a while.

It almost hurts to give this review, but I must. We have been here probably 20 times.  Most of our visits were with district school kids prior to school social events. Regardless of visit, one thing is common, the service is VERY slow.  Sometimes, it has been horrifyingly slow.  Our last visit, our waitress was downright (for lack of better term) surly/obnoxious--almost making fun of how our group of 20 was demanding too much (after waiting nearly 20 minutes just for drink orders.) Look....we are Red Robin fans, and frankly we REALLY want to see this location improve.  It is my hope that Manager or Owner sees these reviews and will agree, time to REALLY address service. This location isn't even fun to visit, so we choose to go to another location. With all that said, the food is sub par at best.  Often cold, forget about asking for condiments or special requests OR even being asked for fry refill. I'm sorry, but this location needs some serious re-work.  For ONCE in my Yelping experience, the plethora of reviewers is accurate here.

My family and I love Red Robin, but his Red Robin is a disappointment.  Service is non existing and management isn't doing anything to change it. We were sat by an employee that seemed that he didn't want to be at work, did not greet us at all. Our waitress was so inundated that she forgot a few things with our meal and took her awhile to give us refills.  A few times I even caught her chatting with other employees instead of checking with her customers. As for the "bottomless fries"...it takes the act of congress to get them and when we received them, they were sitting under a hot lamp for a while. As I said, we love Red Robin, but we're not going to this one again.  I'll drive to Roseville for better experience.

We keep trying, but the service here is sooo slow, and you can forget about bottomless steak fries: you are lucky to get one serving!  I ordered chicken tortilla soup, and it had ZERO chicken in it.  We love RR, but this location is really dissapointing.

My wife and I were regulars here. Once a week we ate dinner here and for a short while it was always great. The staff was very attentive, we got fries and drinks refilled before they were gone. There was 1 bar tender who has akways been amazing, she always remembered us and was very friendly. (Still is, just havent seen her in a while.) As time went on, the portions became smaller and the fries ended up not being bottomless any more. We started having to ask for refills. Our food came out late and cold. The staff seemed to have an issue just doing their job. Mind you, we have always been very generous tippers. For that reason, the staff remembered us. With a few changes to the employees and evidently policies, service declined drastically. we finally had enough and took a long break. after about 4 months we decided to try take out. surprise, the same issues arose. I made the mistake of tipping the girl who handed me the bag (a random employee I haven't seen since), walking out and driving home without checking the bag. I get home to find my wife's entire meal is missing. when I called they gave me attitude and actually asked me if I was sure. I insisted they made a mistake and I wanted it corrected. they offered to "remake" it if I would come back. yes, red robin, I lied. I wanted a free entree. seriously? I spoke with the manager and he had the same attitude. so, I drive back and tell them I want them to make it right. give me a coupon or something. they refused. I then told them I wanted my money back, or at the very least, the tip I left for what seems to be incompetence. nope. so we take a break again. go back a month or two later, I check the bag, missing appetizer and sauce. really? break. again. we go back last night. I specifically ask for extra dipping sauce and au jus. fail again. they have to go in the back and get it. fine. get home... cold tiny portioned food. we live 5 minutes away and arrived on time. why the cold food? absolutely ridiculous. what an awful place to eat. save your money or go to the other one. this place is a joke.

What a scam! They should tell you that they are going to charge you to play a trivia game on the tablet at your table....instead the server just says "yeah I'm sorry, it's not very self explanatory" when you get your check and see the charge. Should not have been a surprise, the service at this location has been terrible for years.
My wife and I just had lunch and received GREAT service from Noe. He never let our drinks run out, was very friendly, and we were never waiting for anything long at all. Great job!

I have been to many Red Robins and always thought their hamburgers and fries were always delicious. The Red Robin in Lincoln is the worst one I have ever been to. The fries are greasy and served warm and the hamburgers taste like they were cooked ahead of time and warmed up when the order is put in. The bun on the hamburger is totally soggy. For a place not being so busy, it's also not the cleanest.

Our amazing dining experience couldn't have been done without our server, Logan! We arrived on a busy Friday night. The small wait at the front door didn't intimidate us, knowing that the bar area is open seating (21 and over at all times,)we decided to high tail it over there and easily found open tables & booths. Red Robin has changed over the years. It got away from its Red diner look and has gone into a more modern look. Sleek wooden framed booths, dark glass dividers, more tv's...  more appealing to the adult eye...steering away from the family oriented restaurant it has always been known for.  Anyways,  My bff and I sat at the table next to the kitchen to watch the action. Servers, bussers, and 1 or 2 kitchen staff flying through the doors...made me think of Chef Ramsey, he could be bursting through the doors any second saying something absurd... Lol Logan greeted us right away. He was energetic, knowledgeable, and when we ordered appetizers, he showed us how to do it on the table device. So smart! We only waited a short period of time for my wedge salad. It looked perfect! My friend ordered chili cheese fries. Since it needed to have melted cheese, it took a few minutes longer. We paid on the little device on the table. It's much faster, easier, and more convenient for the servers on a busy night. It allows you to split your check, leave a top, and do a small survey.... I personally like the device :-) Our food was delicious, Logan was always around,making sure our food was good, asked what else we wanted... he was on top of things the whole time! Thank you, Logan and thank you Red Robin for an quick awesome dinner!

Went here for dinner 1 hour before they closed. Our server was awesome. I don't remember her name but, she was the only one working in the dinning room last night, since it was so late.  She chatted with the kids we had with us and was just a sweet gal. She never made us feel rushed either. The food was very good too. We too had bottomless fries with our meal. I didn't feel the need to get a refill on the fries, nor did my daughter. Our server went ahead and brought some out for my friend who didn't even order a meal. ow sweet is that?  I have read in other reviews that they are not generous with the fries refills. Maybe these guest should just eat what you have and ask for more when you run out. I'm sure they are doing that to avoid the huge waste that goes on with food in this country.  All in all, we had a great experience at RR.

The service was painfully slow and the food was mediocre, which to happen at a chain restaurant is pretty bad.  My daughter's grilled cheese sandwich had unmelted cold cheese and she refused to eat it.  At that point it was well beyond the amount of time you would expect a toddler to remain patient sitting at a table. Oh, and what's so monstrous about the Monster Shakes?!?  The chocolate malt shake was puny and I could barely discern any malt at all.  I think I am done with the Red Robin chain (the Yuba City location is even worse). Also, I second all the complaints about the fries.  Why are they being so stingy with a food item that is so cheap for them to serve?  They bring them out 10 fries at a time and take 20 minutes to bring more, of course after you have to ask for it.

Lets start off FOOD IS GOOD  but the service really is just  terrible. We were seated and waited 10 min before anyone came by to take our drink order then it was 10 min before we got them.  As we finally ordered our food. again the food was good but if your going to offer endless fry's please have them ready and bring them out I had to ask 3 times to get more fry's.  The place was not that busy the server seemed to be walking around and not doing anything productive.  I was nice and tried to joke with him. But the thing is I go there to get a burger and eat fry's.  I really think that they should get things organized better.  I will go one more time to make sure,  but it's strike 2
Great service, Erin was awesome!! Food was out fast during a busy lunch....We'll be back soon!

We support our local businesses..but my one of my favorite restaurant chains has let us down so many times at the Lincoln location. We had a special occasion with my family of 8 and 6 of the orders were wrong and 2 orders for the salad had to be sent back because the lettuce was brown and slimy. An hour and a half later and sending orders back 3 times with no success..we left angry, hungry and completely disappointed..when it's good it's good..but most of the times it's really bad. Sorry guys. Step it up because it's a small town and we can drive to Roseville for a better food and service.

This location has great burgers, the food is consistently good. However, the service is very slow. The few times we have been to this location there has been long wait times after ordering our food and often there are small mistakes with the order.  We placed an order to go not too long ago, they told us the food would be ready in a half hour. We showed up for pick up forty minutes later and ended up having to wait another 25 minutes for our food.  Working in the service industry I hate complaining about service time and I always give places second chances to make up for any mishaps that may take place. However, this location consistently disappoints when it comes to service.

If you enjoy cold soggy burgers and fries while eating amoung un-bussed tables along with an extremely unprofessional staff then this Red Robin is for you! We we've always been huge fans of the Red Robin's and have always had a good experiences, but we were shocked out of our boots by the performance of this location! Even the manager and other employees acted in an extremely unprofessional manner after expressing our dissatisfaction. If you are considering a good burger in the area I might recommend the Carl's Jr next door.

I am very pleased with this Red Robin location.  We have dined in one time and both the food and service was terrific.  Recently, we have placed to-go orders and the food was excellent and orders were accurate, even with special requests.  This will be our go-to Red Robin from now on:)

Sadly this Red Robin has had huge issues with consistency over the years. Based on our meal and service today they are not at a high point.  Our fried appetizer came greasy and limp. When we brought it to the server's attention, which took awhile, she ordered another which then arrived right before our food, and thus was no longer an "appetizer." When our bill came, we had TWO appetizers charged on it! My burger was ok but my husband's was not well seasoned.  The cutlery was not clean.   I ordered sweetener for my tea and didn't get it until asking twice.  The wrong sauce was brought with the crummy appetizer... Overall, very disappointing.  The Roseville location is 100x better.

The burgers  were great. The fries were cRispy as ordered, and our server was attentive. But we waited for over 15 minutes for more fries, and they never came. The server came back more than once and Informed us they were still waiting, but still, no fries.  Overall decent food, but disappointing. Kitchen staff needs some improvement.

This was the second time we went there, and it was exactly the same.  The waitress took our order and we waited about 40 minutes to get our food even-though it was not that busy, fries portion was small so I order extra fries and waited about 30 minutes to get the extra fries, by the time I got them I was done with my burger.  The waitress forgot our appetizer and never checked on us to see if we needed refills or anything else.  The place was not that packed.   I'm not sure if the problem is with the kitchen or service or both.  We won't be back!

I have been here a few times and the servers have always been very nice! From my perspective as someone in the service industry I think they must have some kitchen issues. The food takes forever to come out after you order, and also we usually ask for a basket of fries before we get food and they never bring it out to us. I don't know why they have an issue doing it seeing as I don't work there... it kinda comes off a bit rude.
Disappointed as always with this location! Waited to be seated and watched the host lag to the front to help us after waiting 5 minutes.  No basket of fries delivered. Food was

So for days I was craving red robin because the smell of yummy burgers when I walk out of work is amazing. Well it was a little short of amazing. The food was just ok and not amazing as I had hoped. The service was great even after all the fumbles of our order and food. May be awhile before I try it again.

Red robin lincoln Ordered a make your own burger at 1020 pm waitress had horrible service, the food was horrible cold fries pink burger not satisfied will not be coming to this location again And what terrible is i dont even leave reviews but this experience was the worst ive had.

It''s Red Robin- I'm certainly not expecting a Michelin star experience but please do what you do and do it well. I've been coming here since they've opened and it it was the only place in town to eat in town after 8 pm when my son played baseball.  Although I've never thought it was great, I was never compelled to share my thoughts. UNTIL NOW.  Thought by sitting on the bar side we'd receive attentive service.  Oops.  Why bother with servers when I ask to order an appetizer and she tells me to put it through the kiosk? I should have realized at the beginning she has ZERO interest in interacting with her customers.  I could go on and on from there but in the interest of time (and boring the reader to death) I won't. She could learn a ton from her co-worker (super nice guy with the beard that values his customers.) Cold soggy food, inattentive server and a receipt that won't print out. All of this for $80 for a party of three. In addition to all that they're out of Kendall Jackson Chardonnay on a Friday at 6 p.m. My choices were horrible house wine or no name pinot grigio. UGH.  How this happens at the beginning of a weekend is beyond me.  Clearly they're relying on that they are the only game in town. Very disappointing.

We love this Red Robin.  I mean, all of the Red Robins we go to are pretty awesome, but this one is closer to home and less crowded than the Roseville Galleria location.   We usually go for the Avo-Cobb-O salad with honey mustard, the Ensenada Chicken Platter, or a burger so we can share the endless steak fries.  My husband and I both love the Honey Mustard (Poppy?) dressing.   All the servers here have been great.  Most recently, we have been impressed by serve Noe's attentive service.  He is awesome! Make sure to sign up for their Red Robin Rewards loyalty program.  You get a free item after your 10th, as well as a birthday burger during your birthday month.   Plenty of parking in this center.  Located near the Big 5 Sporting Goods store and Lowe's.   Red Robin, YUMMMMM!!!

I love this Red Robin. I live right between the one in Roseville across from the Galleria and this one in Lincoln. I have been to both many times but I prefer this one in Lincoln. It's got a nice parking lot where finding a space has never been an issue. The location is clean and well-taken care of. The employees are always friendly. Whenever we come here, we try to get a booth inside the bar area. You don't have to wait for a table with the hostess. Just walk into the bar and see if there are any seats available. This is perfect for catching a game while enjoying some awesome food and drink. I've had the pleasure of having Noe take care of my wife and I whenever we sit at the bar. He is always friendly, enthusiastic about his work, and efficient. He always comes back to check on us to see if we need a refill on beverages or fries. It's almost like he knows when our glasses or basket of fries are nearing empty and in need of a refill. I've seen his interaction with other customers and he is just as friendly and awesome. He recognizes us and never disappoints with his service. My favorite menu items are: Avo-cobb-o salad with honey mustard dressing or the guacomole bacon burger. It's even good if you substitute the beef patty with either a turkey patty or the Boca patty.... yes, I said Boca patty. It's the best veggie substitute that tastes close to beef. without having the funky texture. The garlic fries are awesome but you can't go wrong with the regular fries. If you get garlic fries, there is an extra charge though but it is bottomless. Whichever fries you order, make sure to get honey mustard on the side. This is hands down the best honey mustard anywhere. Can't find an analog in the grocery stores or other restaurants. If you are a honey mustard fan, this is the bomb. I wish I could buy this. It's that good. The strawberry lemonade is always often but I am particular to the peach iced tea. It's not as sweet as the strawberry lemonade but just as refreshing. I love coming here because it is not overwhelmingly crowded and not hectic. This is a great location for a yummy meal. Other locations, you will have to fight for parking, wait for a table, and feel like your cramped. Not at this Lincoln location. It's just an awesome location. If you have a chance to eat in the bar area, I hope that you have a chance to be taken care of by Noe. He's a great employee.

I did something I have NEVER done before when coming to Red Robin. EVER!!! I didn't eat a single French fry. How terrible is that?!?! VERY!!! Stupid diet. Stupid love handles. Stupid will power. Geez, just give in and eat ONE French fry. Sorry, sometimes you need to argue with yourself.  I didn't even order a burger if ANY kind. Even left the chicken sandwiches alone. I went with the chicken avocado Cobb salad. 550 calories and 60 grams of protein. It had chicken, avo, bacon, eggs and tomatoes on it. Pretty good. Not as great with out French fries but still pretty good.  Ill be back someday pretty soon for a gut bomb artery clogging good time. You can count on that!
Loved the royal red burger.  Burger with an egg wow didn't think I would like it but it was delicious.  I will be back just for that.  Thanks

I came in today for lunch and had the worst experience I wish I didn't even eat here. They took my order and when they brought it out my sweet potato fries were missing I asked our waitress Trisha where my fries were she said "oh no one brought them out?"  It took them over 20 minutes to bring them out. By that time I was done eating the manager shay I think brought them out and was rude about it asking "do you still want the fries?" Obviously I did but 20 minutes passed by I was done eating and if I waited my food would of been cold. Customer service was horrible I would give it ZERO stars. They didn't even apologize for messing up the order and/or taking too long. Will not be returning here ever.
I love this place, you don't have to wait long. The food is yummy. The customer service is amazing.  Go here you will love the food, the customer service.

Normally I love the Place when I go there and sit.  This time I ordered for take out and was not pleased with what I received.  First of all, I waited at the bar and Noe was great and attentive always asking if I want refills and letting me know about order.   The problem was after I got home.  I ordered the Fish and chips. The fish was great but I only got 8 french fries.  I feel like I got cheated.. I guess from now on, I'll have them open the box before I leave to check contents...

Disgusting. Never going back. We walked in and the hostess wasn't attentive but we saw that he was in the back and stared right at us for a good few minutes jibber jabbing with other coworkers before he came and sat us. Food was terrible. Fries were cold and seemed old. Waste of $50 that could've been spent elsewhere.

I have never been a huge fan of Red Robin's but generally it's adequate to good. This Res Robin was one of my worst dining experiences ever. Right off the bat with the host did this place already turn me off of it. I walk in and there's no one at the podium, ok that's fine, as I wait I'm looking around and I see an employee in the dining area straight ahead talking to two gentlemen at the table. I figured he was the host and being genial with patrons, so at first I was fine with the wait. After quite a few minutes he walks up and seats me in the same area as those guys he was talking to and here is when I find out that they weren't guest but merely his coworkers that were on break. He made me wait pointlessly just because he wanted to gossip and not do his damn job. This was strike number one for this place. Once we are seated my waitress wasn't that polite and welcoming at all. Was rushing us a bit but hey we came in at a bit before 9:00PM maybe she was getting off soon, so I can forgive her a bit. She took our orders and the appetizers arrived promptly afterward. The cheese sticks were good but the tavern fries were just depressing, the fries were cold and the cheese wasn't fully melted. Every time I would grab a fry to try another one hoping the previous one was a fluke and eventually it'll be good but it never happened. Finally after that pile of depression our burgers arrived and it did not get any better. I got the black & bleu burger and something about the flavor just didn't taste right compared to previous Red Robin's. I took 3 bites and called it a day. The side of fries that came with was just another spiral of depression with how far this rabbit hole of disgust could go. My girlfriend said her burger was bad and that we could've got tastier food from dumpster diving behind an Applebee's that shared a dumpster with a dog kennel.  Overall I will only ever come to this Red Robin again if I'm forced by gunpoint to go in though I'd rather taste the bullet than taste the food here ever again. Terrible.

Sub par visit yesterday. Place was half full but had a long wait to be seated. Had a longer wait for a server. Had a longer wait for food to arrive.  Food wasn't worth any of the waits. Not quite as good as Carl's Jr at three times the price. Adios RR.

I wish I could remember our waiters name! He was amazing. Had dinner last night on 4/16. Food came out fast and extra fries were given to us before our food even got there. He recommended campfire sauce and it was "life changing" just like he said :)

So in Lincoln we are somewhat limited to restaurants. Of course right down the road there are plenty of options but when we want to stay local we only have so many. We have frequented Red Robin multiple times at this location with normally positive things to say. The service is generally great, drinks are cold and delicious and the food is quickly prepared. However, yesterday we decided to drop in for a late lunch and grab some food. Service was so-so for it being slow. The food on the other hand was super bland. We had artichoke dip that was not good, small portion and just not flat out not good. We both had wraps that were dry, not tight. The wife had avocado that looked like it was sitting out for 2 hours. Red Robin is generally a solid choice that is consistent. This particular visit wasn't so much and I wanted to reflect that in a yelp review with hopes of them stepping up there service and product. Hell, I worked at a Red Robin forever ago. Its not that hard. Cheers.

Spent time with family. Upon arrival, surprised it was not busy. Waited to be seated. Then we saw a another family come thru the doors and got sat immediately...  When our time came, we ended up near the kitchen. Not a good place to be, unless you want to hear a loud manager yell ," Who wants to work a double shift tomorrow!" ..., or the cooks playing around in the kitchen.  Maybe it was because we had a baby and the hostess didn't want us around others'. Who knows, but it could have been better seating.  Our utensils very extremely dirty and I asked the waitress to bring us cleaner ones. They ended up being  the same ones. Oh well... I guess that explains why this restaurant was empty.  The food was good by the way and my family always make a uncomfortable time enjoyable regardless!!

The best part about the Lincoln location is that it's not busy, if you have kids like I do, I suggest this location - if the quality of food isn't your concern. Do not visit here if you are craving Res Robin, you will be disappointed.  Service was good. Our server was friendly.  Food was not good. Definitely the most disappointing burger from any Red Robin I have ever visited.  My burger was over cooked and borderline burnt. The bun was old and stale tasting.  My beer was delicious, and the fries were, too!

It's improved a bit, and I no longer recommend the restaurant at strikes under any circumstances, it is truly garbage.  I think the royal Robin is their best burger.  Also, they put margarine on all their burgers so if you want, request none of that.

So,I was in the area for a work conference and stopped in at this Red Robin. It was during lunch time not too busy service seemed rushed. Food was decent/ fries could have been less greasy. Con- afterwards we wanted to pay and they have this machine at the table to pay with card. It was not user friendly and we wanted to also pay cash obviously it does not accept cash. Our server should have just took our payment instead of having us trying to pay for it ourselves at the table. Can be time consuming.

I love this place!  I'm pretty simple i always sit in the bar and the two guys that usually work in there are amazing! if you get Logan you'll never need to ask for a refill on your drinks. the other guy totally forget his name sorry it's also pretty amazing and always willing to offer up suggestions for beers. I usually get the Smokey Tavern double on a lettuce bun. I always get all the Fry's I need and I usually dip em in there Ranch campfire sauce or the buffalo sauce they have it's really amazing. I've sat in the regular dining area twice and I've always had great service as well never a complaint. I usually stop in maybe once or twice a week it's no surprise since I love their burgers and I always get a free burger every 10 with their rewards program.

Unfortunately the food was a disappointment. I ordered togo, when I got home I opened up my food container which had a BBQ chicken crap that had basically no filling in it and what I thought was hilarious was that my daughters kids chicken tender meal had more fries than my adult meal. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the host brought the food out to my car due to I'm 40 weeks pregnant which was very sweet.

Decent food and decent service. Ive been here many times and only did i walk out saying the service stood out when it was a female bartender. She was personable and genuine. Other than that its never been great. No reason for five stars.

This place is severely understaffed. I've been to my fair share of Red Robins in between tournament games and just on the road. This is the worst one I've ever been to.
