Food was pretty decent actually--fries were great as usual but it's pretty hard to screw up fries so... Like I mentioned earlier, it's SUPER UNDERSTAFFED! I went on a Monday night and it was pretty full, but somehow they found a way to make it so our receipt took practically seven years and 20 "I'll be right back with your receipt"s to arrive at our table. The bill was paid but we didn't know that until we got our receipt seven years later because the stupid table kiosk said the purchase didn't go through. We tried to use the kiosk twice. We entered the tip but agreed it should be less because of the unfriendly waitress. She wasn't mean, just very unfriendly. There were about 3 waiters/waitresses to wait on 100 people. Also there were too many screaming kids inside.

The food tastes the same at every single Red Robin location, so I'm not going to talk about their greasy, fattening burgers. However, the service here is absolutely awful. This Red Robin is severely understaffed, with a few unenthusiastic servers trying to juggle way too many tables. We sat at our table for 30 minutes after we were served dessert waiting for our receipt. Couple that with noisy children at almost every table and listening to the ear-murdering happy birthday song every five minutes and you get one of the worst dining experiences in Lincoln.

Place sucks .went there the frist time and it was good. Second time was not good. So i thouth it was bad luck that day. So went back next week. And my food was cold. So.i said would never go back. But then last week my neighbor gave me a 25 dollars card to go there. So why not it was free brought my son it me. Had a chicken sandwich.  It was cold  again. Got home and was sick all night had to call in to work.

Service is was ok?... But if you come expecting to have a few beers and watch some football, I'd think about going somewhere else. Manager, I'm guessing she was trying to see what is on offer then football, changes the Chanel and could figure out how to get it back to the game. Then they argued with us about changing of the Chanel's. Even the waiter said something about females and remote controls, not a good mix. If it wasn't for the good burgers and fries we'd go somewhere else.
Ordered to go. The food was horrible: ordered black n blue burger with sweet potato fries, which were soggy and cold. The bread on the burger was hard and cold. Will not go back.
This chain use to be a weekly stop, that was years ago. Service at this location was good food was mediocre at best.

Won't go back to this location... I usually love Red Robin but this location is terrible. Took 22 mins just to get our drink menu taken, then our food was cold because that took 40 minutes to get. The people we sat next to had the same complaint! Won't be back

We were very disappointed yesterday.  We love the breaded cod and we always get it with your delicious cole slaw.  Guess what?  We ordered it to go and the cole slaw had no dressing on it....just shredded cabbage and there were no lemon wedges or tartar sauce included.  What a waste...will have to check our order in the future IF we go back.

This is my favorite go to restaurant in Lincoln. There is rarely if ever a wait for a table at the times we go (usually early dinner). The lunch rush can be pretty busy especially in the bar room but we did find a table. (Self seating in the bar- find a table and take it). The servers are usually on task and attentive. I actually like the table top check pay option, no waiting for a bill, change,etc-just pay and go! The burgers have always been fresh, juicy and full of flavor. The fries are good with unlimited refills. They will alter or make substitutions without a fuss and unless it's a premium upgrade, it's no cost! If you like turkey burgers, theirs is perfectly seasoned and juicy-really the best turkey patty I think I've ever had. The condiments they offer are also very good. And the campfire sauce, in my opinion, is so delicious I could drink it!  I haven't ordered a burger I didn't like but the Siracha double tavern is my current favorite, a perfect blend of flavors and just the right size. Don't forget to ask for campfire sauce on the side for dipping your fries an adding to the burger!

I've been to this location three times and I've ordered takeout once. Every single time, the service is extremely slow. The utensils never seem to be entirely clean, the hamburgers look like the thin dry patties you get in bulk from the freezer section. The plates they serve on are strange orange plastic plates, like something you would use camping, or give a child to throw on the ground.  I do not recommend coming to this restaurant.  I give two stars instead of one because the hostess was delightful, considerate and opened the doors for us.

Worst Red Robin I've ever been to.  Was on hold for 15 minutes on the phone just to see the wait time. The waiter didn't talk to us for 10 minutes.  Was very rude to us when taking the order. Yelling "I can't hear a word you're saying to my little brothers that are in elementary school. I have celiac desiese, so I ordered a gluten free but and gluten free fries. When the waiter didn't ask me if it was an allergy I told him that it was indeed and allergy and he responded "well, yeah"   Once I got my food I took one bite into my burger and chocked on a hair. I was hacking and coughing at the table then proceeded to run to the bathroom. When I got back to the table (with the hair still stuck in my throat) the waiter and some guy came over and told me that the cooks were wearing hats...  After they left, I went to eat my "gluten free fries" they had seasoning salt on them. (Not gluten free)  I work at a Red Robin and I know how things SHOULD go. This was horrible. Worst restaurant experience I've ever had.

One of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long time. I should have known it would be bad when we called to check wait times and were put on hold for 15 minutes. When we arrived, they told us to wait on the bench while they seated others who came in after us. Once seated, we were forced to wait around another 10 minutes for our server to offer us drinks, although we were ready to order food at that point. Our server was very rude and made us repeat ourselves multiple times when we were speaking quite clearly and loudly. He got things wrong and we had to correct him, almost writing down broccoli when we clearly said salad. My sister did not receive the usual request of "pink or no pink" for her burger and did not get to choose her cheese. She also choked on a huge hair found in her burger and almost threw up. The server and manager proceeded to make excuses and dodge responsibility. Incompetence in almost every regard by the staff and an all around TERRIBLE dining experience. Management needs to make serious changes.

Took the family out last Saturday and paid thru the kiosk tool on the table. At the end of paying the kiosk had an error come up. Waitress said my payment didn't go through. I pulled up my banking info on my phone and showed where the charge is pending..so thought that would be enough. She brought the manager over and I showed her the same...They both confirmed that it wasn't going to go through and they closed that ticket. Made me run my card again which I didn't want to do. But my bank account wasn't enough proof for these people. Well guess what BOTH charges came out 2 days later and I'm still waiting to get my money back. Called and spoke to couple of different managers and get same response...I.T. is working on it...never get a courtesy call like promised..just horrible!! Oh best part I got a $15 Egift card for a meal that cost us $71!!!!!!!

I've only been to Red Robin a handful of times my whole life.  But the first couple times I went, I remember enjoying it.  Usually when we go out we pick Indian, Thai, or Japanese over anything else.  Over the years I've lost my taste for the larger chain restaurants.  But the other night we decided to take the whole family to Red Robin.  The service was decent.  I was concerned about that because of the reviews.  But we got in and were served pretty quickly.  But the California Chicken burger that I used to enjoy years ago was different from how I remembered it.  I remember it being more crisp.  But now it's soggy.  Overall, it was pricey for what we got, and most of us just felt icky after we left.  Also I ordered one of the special tequila margaritas.  So I paid several dollars more for a better brand of tequila, but I could tell that they skimped on the tequila.   Add to that there was a $1.99 entertainment fee added to the bill -presumably because my husband poked around for a few seconds on the device that was sitting on the table.   All together we spent over $25 more than if we'd gone to a good Indian or Thai restaurant, and it wasn't nearly as satisfying.
